intro: Helichrysum mutabile, commonly known as the everlasting daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant is known for its ability to retain its color and form even after drying, making it popular in floral arrangements. Its leaves are typically gray-green and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are woody and often branched. Helichrysum mutabile thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species.
